bwwExcerpt: "Ionesco called "Exit the King" "an attempt at an apprenticeship in dying," a description that, though perfectly accurate as far as it goes, fails to convey the macabre gusto of this now-ludicrous, now-terrifying parable of dissolution and resignation. Mr. Rush, however, gets the point right in the heart: The decayed flamboyance of his performance as the dying king is the stuff Tonys are made of.
